items.text: I feel completely at ease when speaking in front of large crowds.
items.rationale: Social confidence and fearlessness in evaluative situations are core features of Boldness.

items.text: I thrive in high-pressure situations where others would panic.
items.rationale: Stress immunity and composure under threat are central to the Boldness construct.

items.text: I've never really understood what people mean when they say they're paralyzed by fear.
items.rationale: Low fear reactivity and difficulty relating to others' anxiety reflect the low-fear temperament underlying Boldness.

items.text: People often describe me as someone who has a commanding presence in any room.
items.rationale: Social dominance and assertive self-assurance are hallmark features of Boldness.

items.text: I can stay perfectly calm and clear-headed during emergencies.
items.rationale: Stress immunity — maintaining cognitive clarity under acute threat — is a defining facet of Boldness.

items.text: I am naturally drawn to activities that involve physical risk or danger.
items.rationale: Venturesomeness and tolerance for physical risk reflect the low-fear temperament central to Boldness.

items.text: I have a strong sense of confidence in my own abilities, even when others doubt me.
items.rationale: Resilient self-assurance and immunity to social evaluation are core to Boldness.

items.text: I find it easy to take charge of a situation, even when no one asks me to.
items.rationale: Social dominance and initiative-taking in ambiguous situations reflect Boldness.

items.text: I rarely second-guess myself, even when the stakes are very high.
items.rationale: Decisiveness under pressure and low anticipatory anxiety are characteristic of Boldness.

items.text: I've been told I have an unusual ability to remain composed when others are falling apart.
items.rationale: Third-person observation of stress immunity, a core Boldness facet.

items.text: I genuinely enjoy being the center of attention in social situations.
items.rationale: Social confidence and comfort with evaluation reflect the interpersonal dominance aspect of Boldness.

items.text: Dangerous situations give me a feeling of excitement rather than dread.
items.rationale: Positive affective response to threat cues reflects the low-fear, venturesomeness facet of Boldness.

items.text: I can talk my way into or out of almost any situation with ease.
items.rationale: Social efficacy maps to Boldness, but persuasive charm could also reflect the interpersonal manipulation seen in Meanness.

items.text: I adapt quickly to new and unfamiliar environments without feeling anxious.
items.rationale: Low anxiety in novel contexts is consistent with Boldness, though adaptability is not exclusively a psychopathy-related trait.

items.text: I sometimes take big risks just because the thrill feels too good to pass up.
items.rationale: Thrill-seeking overlaps with Boldness (venturesomeness) but the impulsive, reward-driven quality could also reflect Disinhibition.

items.text: I frequently act on impulse without thinking about the consequences.
items.rationale: Impulsivity and failure to consider consequences are defining features of Disinhibition.

items.text: I have a hard time sticking with long-term goals because I get bored easily.
items.rationale: Lack of planfulness and low boredom tolerance are core facets of Disinhibition.

items.text: I've had problems with alcohol or drugs at various points in my life.
items.rationale: Substance use problems are a well-established behavioral correlate of the externalizing liability captured by Disinhibition.

items.text: People who know me well would say I'm unreliable and hard to count on.
items.rationale: Irresponsibility and undependability are central behavioral manifestations of Disinhibition.

items.text: I often make promises I know I probably won't keep.
items.rationale: Fraudulence and irresponsibility in commitments reflect the unreliability facet of Disinhibition.

items.text: My temper gets the best of me more often than I'd like to admit.
items.rationale: Poor emotional regulation and reactive aggression are hallmarks of Disinhibition.

items.text: I've been fired from jobs or kicked out of school because of my behavior.
items.rationale: Behavioral problems leading to institutional consequences reflect the broad externalizing pattern of Disinhibition.

items.text: When I want something, I go after it immediately without waiting or planning.
items.rationale: Urgency and lack of premeditation are core impulsivity facets within Disinhibition.

items.text: I get into arguments and physical altercations more than most people.
items.rationale: Reactive aggression and poor behavioral control are central to Disinhibition.

items.text: I find it nearly impossible to resist temptation, even when I know it will cause problems.
items.rationale: Deficient self-regulation and inability to override prepotent responses are defining features of Disinhibition.

items.text: I've borrowed money from people with no real intention of paying them back.
items.rationale: Financial irresponsibility and fraudulence are behavioral indicators of Disinhibition.

items.text: My life has been chaotic — I've moved around a lot and had unstable relationships.
items.rationale: Lifestyle instability across multiple domains is a well-documented correlate of Disinhibition.

items.text: I tend to blame others for problems that are really my own fault.
items.rationale: Blame externalization is consistent with Disinhibition's irresponsibility, though it could also reflect the callous deflection seen in Meanness.

items.text: I sometimes lie to get what I want, even when the truth would work just as well.
items.rationale: Pathological lying maps to Disinhibition (fraudulence/impulsive dishonesty) but could also reflect the strategic deception of Meanness.

items.text: I enjoy manipulating situations to my advantage, and I'm good at it.
items.rationale: While exploitativeness can stem from poor self-regulation (Disinhibition), deliberate and skilled manipulation is more characteristic of Meanness.

items.text: I honestly don't care if my actions hurt other people, as long as I get what I want.
items.rationale: Callous disregard for others' welfare and exploitative self-interest are defining features of Meanness.

items.text: I find it amusing to watch other people struggle or suffer.
items.rationale: Cruelty and enjoyment of others' distress reflect the callousness and lack of empathy central to Meanness.

items.text: I use people for what they can give me and move on when they're no longer useful.
items.rationale: Exploitativeness and shallow, instrumental relationships are core interpersonal features of Meanness.

items.text: Other people's emotions don't really affect me — I just don't feel what they feel.
items.rationale: Empathy deficits and emotional detachment are central to the Meanness construct.

items.text: I have intentionally humiliated someone just to show them who's in charge.
items.rationale: Deliberate cruelty for dominance reflects the aggressive, callous interpersonal style of Meanness.

items.text: I see most people as weak and easy to take advantage of.
items.rationale: Contemptuous attitudes toward others and predatory worldview are hallmarks of Meanness.

items.text: I've never felt guilty about anything I've done to another person.
items.rationale: Absence of guilt and remorse is a defining affective deficit in Meanness.

items.text: When someone cries in front of me, I feel nothing — maybe even a little annoyed.
items.rationale: Emotional coldness and irritation at others' vulnerability reflect the empathy deficits central to Meanness.

items.text: I enjoy having power over others and making them do what I want.
items.rationale: Dominance-seeking and coercive control over others are core interpersonal features of Meanness.

items.text: I would describe myself as cold-hearted, and I don't see that as a problem.
items.rationale: Self-acknowledged callousness with ego-syntonic acceptance is characteristic of Meanness.

items.text: I've deliberately sabotaged someone's success because it benefited me.
items.rationale: Instrumental aggression and willingness to harm others for personal gain are defining behavioral features of Meanness.

items.text: Animals and children don't stir any particular warmth or protectiveness in me.
items.rationale: Absence of nurturant affect even toward vulnerable beings reflects the deep empathy deficits of Meanness.

items.text: I can be charming and friendly when I need something from someone, but it's all an act.
items.rationale: Superficial charm used instrumentally maps to Meanness, though the deceptive quality could also reflect Disinhibition (fraudulence) or Boldness (social efficacy).

items.text: I don't form close emotional bonds with people — relationships are more transactional for me.
items.rationale: Shallow attachment and relational detachment are consistent with Meanness, though some emotional detachment can also appear in Boldness as low anxious attachment.

items.text: I remain completely unfazed when delivering bad news that devastates other people.
items.rationale: Emotional composure in distressing interpersonal contexts could reflect Meanness (callousness/empathy deficit) or Boldness (stress immunity and emotional resilience).
